column5: This certainly is a walleye site, and a darn good one, but very rarely have I fished a walleye lake where a pike coming along was not a certainty. Usually happens right after the walleye bite has disappeared.

Not sure you caught on to what Griff and I were trying to point out and that was the hypocrisy of Octanehi5, who recently berated a member for asking a question about smallmouth fishing, saying this is a "walleye fishing site"but has had several posts talking about pike and replied to this post about pike fishing. I guess if he fishes for pike it's ok for him to talk about it on this "walleye fishing site", but not ok for others.
I enjoyed the posts, almost as much as catching a big smallmouth.

Now your talking about real Canadian shield fishing ,In 25 + yrs. of fishing Canada, On the Gouin or Hebert you Will not be fishing for Smallmouth. And by the way to cover talking about Pike on a walleye site. walleyes are the best bait for pike. Make very good table fair as well as the Walleyes, I really try to stick to a walleye topic on this site, And have helped many members of this site. We are all entiteled to our opinions. So don"t get your Panties in a Bunch Boys
What bait or Lures do you use to catch 36 inch plus pike in Gouin or Lake Hebert from opening day to mid June?Thanks
The Onduspoon. Number one lure for pike in Europe.
#4 Len Thompson 5 of diamonds. Land 40 inch plus fish every year on the Gouin with these lures!
I catch lots of large pike on a jig and tail,jig & nitecrawler,jig & leech or jig & minnow while walleye fishing
This yr we are trying large paddletails with home made steel stinger hooks in the tails
I thought this was a Walleye website.
Touch√©. Don't know if anyone else caught that one but I did. In fact he has several threads where he talks about catching, cooking, and eating pike.
